security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and TypeScript code examples. No executable code, scripts, file system access, network calls, or command execution. The skill provides guidance patterns for Express API development.

content.user_title: Build Express APIs with proper REST patterns
content.value_statement: Express API development often leads to inconsistent routes, wrong status codes, and tightly coupled storage logic. This skill provides proven patterns for RESTful routes, HTTP status codes, storage interfaces, and background job management.
actual_capabilities: Verifies REST route conventions for Express APIs
Checks correct HTTP status codes for each operation
Documents background job cleanup and overlap handling
Reviews Express API code for common pitfalls
limitations: Does not generate API code automatically
Does not connect to databases or external services
Does not validate running API implementations
Focuses on patterns, not framework-specific implementations

use_cases.title: Build consistent APIs
use_cases.description: Apply REST conventions and status code patterns when creating new Express routes and endpoints.

use_cases.title: Review API implementations
use_cases.description: Verify existing Express APIs follow best practices for route structure and error handling.

use_cases.title: Design storage interfaces
use_cases.description: Create abstracted storage layers that support different backends and enable easy testing.

prompt_templates.title: New API Route
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new Express route for [resource] following REST conventions. Include validation, proper status codes, and error handling.

prompt_templates.title: Review Routes
prompt_templates.prompt: Review these Express routes for REST compliance, correct status codes, and missing validation. Point out any anti-patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Storage Pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a TypeScript storage interface for [entity] with create, read, update, delete operations. Include an in-memory implementation for testing.

prompt_templates.title: Background Job
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a background job to my Express app that runs every 5 minutes. Include proper cleanup on process exit and overlap protection.

output_examples.input: Create a users API with CRUD operations
output: GET /api/users/:id - Returns single user (200) or not found (404)
PATCH /api/admin/users/:id - Updates user (200) or not found (404)

best_practices: Separate public and admin routes with appropriate auth middleware
Always validate request bodies before processing with middleware
Define storage interfaces to abstract database implementation details
Clean up background job intervals on process termination signals
anti_patterns: Using inconsistent HTTP status codes across similar operations
Skipping input validation on create and update endpoints
Implementing storage logic directly in route handlers
Running overlapping background job executions without protection

faq.question: Does this skill work with Express v5?
faq.answer: Yes. The patterns are version-agnostic and apply to both Express v4 and v5.

faq.question: What status codes does this skill recommend?
Can I use these patterns with other frameworks?
faq.answer: Route and status code patterns apply to any REST API. Storage interfaces work with any backend.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides guidance patterns. It never accesses files or sends data externally.

faq.question: Why are my routes failing validation?
faq.answer: Ensure validateBody middleware is defined and called before your route handler. Check schema definitions.

faq.question: How is this different from documentation?
faq.answer: This skill provides ready-to-use patterns, checklists, and code examples tailored for Claude and Codex.
